text: Hey <@UGMJVSHBJ> That’s not an option, as a security measure our webhooks will only connect to secured endpoints
Hi everyone...I'm trying to reproduce this data with the API :
Hey <@UGULQ6P6D> I think this is the endpoint you are looking for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/email/get_campaign_data>
Hey <@UFBNA9K9A>: Yes...that's the one I'm using at the moment but I think I have to call it for every campaign, and then add up the stats to get the summary.
The problem I'm having is that we have some accounts with ~3,500 campaigns and the API calls are taking quite a while
Is there a way that I'm not seeing in order to get the API endpoint to return the summary stats across all campaigns for me?
Ah I see, I didn’t look at the screenshot carefully enough and thought it was a single email, now I see you are on the overview screen
No, there isn’t an endpoint for the overall performance of emails

Based on my attempt to reverse engineer the code, it looks like the HubSpot app is using this : <https://api.HubSpot.com/cosemail/v1/statistics/list> - but that API seems to be private and not exposed. Any chance that's going to change?
Also - in the meantime, am I doing it correctly in terms of pulling the stats for each individual campaign?
I don’t know of any immediate plans but I will pass along the ask.  Is there a particular use this is for?  Like for use in a BI tool or something like that
Yup summing up the individual campaigns is the right approach
yes - we're building a tool that does an in-bound marketing assessment so show people where they are to benchmarks so they can get more out of HubSpot...one of the sections is e-mail performance.
No prob - thanks for the quick response.
